content.description: Scramble up the scree slope to the base of the cliff.  Some minor 5.3-5.5 moves bring you to the base of the large chimney.  Chimney up - it's shady and cool in there.  At the top exit, it's a walk-up to the summit.  Its high and has a view, but not particularly dangerous.  We did not use ropes - we solo freed "together'.  It was the kind of thing to get a teenager's heart pumping.
content.protection: Large nuts and cams, please.  Big cracks, big openings. Hard Volcanic rock.  There are large rocks to anchor.
content.location: Route is up the main cliff face - there is only one.  Scramble to the bottom and find the chimney.  Walk down around the side of the cliff, or rappel the vertical face.

content.description: Private property, I believe - hike up from the Baptist camp.
